academic_resources.key1: Roles of an advisor and advisee

Text.text: What is your primary responsibility as an advisee?
Periodically inform your advisor on how your classes are going
Incorrect: this is not one of your primary requirements as an advisee.
Share information from your advisor with your classmates
Incorrect: this is not one of your primary requirements as an advisee.
Schedule meetings with your advisor each semester
Correct: each student should meet with his/her advisor each semester for help choosing and enrolling classes.
You have no responsibilities beyond what your advisor suggests you to do
Incorrect: try again.
What is the advisor’s primary role?
Help the student adjust to campus life
Incorrect: this is not the primary responsibility of an advisor.
Answer any questions the student has about programs at the university
Incorrect: this is not the primary responsibility of an advisor.
Provide guidance regarding coursework
Correct: this is the primary responsibility of an advisor.
All of the above
Incorrect: not all of these are primary responsibilities of an advisor.
Which is not a place where you can obtain a list of tutors for a particular subject?
The office of the department for the class you need help in
Incorrect. In many department offices, there is a list of tutors for each subject in that department.
The Office of Academic Enrichment
Incorrect. The Office of Academic Enrichment has a list of tutors for each subject, as well as information on group tutoring.
Your advisor’s office
Correct. Your advisor can only direct you to the tutoring services available on campus.
ISE Lab Learning Community Center
Incorrect. There are group tutoring sessions and walk-in hours available at the ISE Lab.
If you need assistance writing a paper, where should you go?
Your professor’s office hours
Incorrect. Your professor is not the best person to go to for help improving your writing skills. Try again.
The Office of Academic Enrichment
Incorrect. The Office of Academic Enrichment provides tutoring services, but not writing assistance. Try again.
The Writing Center
Correct! The Writing Center provides assistance with writing papers.
All of the above
Incorrect. Two of these resources are not designed for writing assistance.
Which of these is not offered on campus?
A writing center
Incorrect. Try again!
Group tutoring
Incorrect. Try again!
Individual tutoring
Incorrect. Try again!
All of the above resources are offered on campus
Which of the following statements is false?
The Physics Help Center is for Physics majors only
Correct! The Physics Help Center is available to any student enrolled in a physics course.
You may only schedule two appointments at the University Writing Center per week
Incorrect, this statement is true. Try again!
There is a separate writing assistance program for multilingual students
Incorrect, this statement is true. Try again!
The Math Tutorial Lab accepts walk-ins
Incorrect, this statement is true. Try again!
